discussion.author: giordano
discussion.text: The package is empty at the moment: https://github.com/AP6YC/CVI.jl/blob/8055c2c463cd9e34b6f90e4196339bd249007978/src/CVI.jl.  Besides, it'd be nice to have a more descriptive name, what about `ClusterValidityIndices`? :slightly_smiling_face:

discussion.author: AP6YC
discussion.text:
> The package is empty at the moment: https://github.com/AP6YC/CVI.jl/blob/8055c2c463cd9e34b6f90e4196339bd249007978/src/CVI.jl. Besides, it'd be nice to have a more descriptive name, what about `ClusterValidityIndices`? ðŸ™‚

Whoopsy! About the project files, they are added to the repo and are passing unit tests. Should I create a new submission request with the populated project?

Also, about the name, I considered was worried about package name length. If the name `CVI` is a poor name and `ClusterValidityIndices` is _not_ too long, then I will be fine with changing the project name.

discussion.author: giordano
discussion.text: Generally speaking we prefer long and descriptive names to short and hard-to-understand ones :wink:  After you rename the package, register it again and a new pull request will be opened.  I'm going to close this one.  Thanks!
